text: TAPACLOTH provides exact test (p-value) assess clonality zygosity read-count data. test based model sequencing outcome following either Binomial Beta-Binomial process, number reads variant represents number successes total number trials corresponding coverage. Since clonal variant within diploid heterozygous tumour genome affects one two alleles tumour cells, success probability counting process corresponds half tumour sample purity. Sub-clonal clonal mutations loss heterozygosity expected respectively smaller larger success probabilities, respectively. Therefore, assume null model clonality, consider every input mutation \(n_v\) reads variant locus; \(n_r\) reads reference locus; sample purity \(\pi\); expected number reads variant follows \[ X_B \sim Bin(\cdot \mid c, \pi/2) \] therefore \[ P(X_B \leq x) = \sum_{k = 0}^x Bin(x \mid c, \pi/2). \] Beta-Binomial case simply follows \(P(X_{BB} \leq x) = \sum_{k = 0}^x \textit{Beta-Bin}(x \mid c, \pi/2, \rho)\) -dipsersion \(\rho\). Beta-Binomial distribution can used take account -dispersion sequencing assay. can take \(\alpha\)-level (e.g., \(10^{-3}\)) invert function determine \[ m^{\text{sub}} = \inf\left\{x\mid P(X \leq x) \leq \alpha\right\} \] \[ m^{\text{loh}} = \inf\left\{x \mid P(X \leq x) > 1 - \alpha\right\} \, . \] determine : \(n_v \leq m^{\text{(sub)}}\) mutation likely subclonal; \(n_v > m^{\text{(loh)}}\) mutation likely clonal loss heterozygosity (LOH) associated; latter case mutation also high multiplicity, meaning wildtype alleles. tumour suppressor gene might imply total inactivation. Two types tests available: exact one based Binomial Beta-Binomial modelling sequencing read counts, approximate based allelic frequencies. former parametrised p-value. Additionally, TAPACLOTH can infer sample purity, information used carry variant classification. Since two tests independent, one can first estimate sample purity use input classification task.
